author: skylenet
content: Which CL clients allow setting the node key via config? Either cli flag or some file

author: skylenet
content: This would be useful for future devnets. So that we can control the column distribution a bit without having to create too many nodes just to cover all columns.

author: manunlp
content:
Prysm:

```
--p2p-priv-key value The file containing the private key to use in communications with other peers.
```

If you don't use this flag, Prysm (on the `peerDAS` branch) will choose one private key randomly, and then will keep the same reboot after reboot.
With this flag, you can set the private key you want to use. (And then, the nodeID is derived from this private key.)
